title: Implement message preview modal with markdown rendering
description:
Add a message preview modal that opens when user presses <enter> on a selected message.

Requirements:
- Open modal on enter key when message is selected
- Display full message content rendered as markdown
- Show message metadata (topic, sender, timestamp, session ID)
- Support scrolling for long messages (viewport)
- Close with esc or enter
- Style consistently with existing modals (OutputModal pattern)

Implementation:
- Create MessagePreviewModal component
- Integrate glamour for markdown rendering
- Add keybinding handler for enter on messages
- Wire into model Update/View cycle
close_reason: Implemented message preview modal with glamour markdown rendering, viewport scrolling, and keyboard navigation

title: Improve active pane visual distinction in TUI
description:
The current focus indicator (▸ and bold title) is too subtle. Users accidentally press enter on the wrong pane.

Options to explore:
- Add a colored border around the focused pane
- Dim/fade the unfocused pane content
- Use a more prominent focus indicator

Should work in both split mode and tab mode.

title: Define core messaging types and store interface
description:

- Message struct with ID, Topic, Payload, Sender, CreatedAt fields
- Topic struct with Name, Messages slice, UpdatedAt
- Store interface with Publish, Subscribe, List, Prune methods

Location: internal/core/messaging/

This establishes the contract before implementing storage or CLI.
close_reason: Created Message, Topic structs and Store interface in internal/core/messaging/

title: Implement global JSON file message store
description:
Implement the messaging Store interface using per-topic JSON files:

- Storage location: $XDG_DATA_HOME/hive/messages/topics/{topic}.json
- Reuse file locking pattern from kvstore.go (in-process mutex + flock)
- Atomic writes via temp file + rename
- Count-based retention: enforce max messages per topic on write (default 100)
- Support topic wildcards for Subscribe (e.g., agent.* matches agent.build, agent.test)
- Support subscribing to all topics when no pattern specified

Location: internal/store/jsonfile/msgstore.go
close_reason: Implemented MsgStore with per-topic JSON files, file locking, atomic writes, count-based retention (default 100), and wildcard topic patterns

title: Research TUI focus indicator design options
description:
The current focus indicator (▸ and bold title) is too subtle - users accidentally press enter on the wrong pane.

## Failed Approaches
1. **Bordered panes** - Added rounded borders around focused pane. Removed header layout, looked cluttered.
2. **Background tint on header** - Added blue background behind focused header text. Looked awful.

## Research Needed
Look at other TUI applications for inspiration on how they handle split pane focus:
- lazygit
- k9s
- btop/htop
- lazydocker
- Other Bubble Tea apps

## Possible Options to Explore
- Different indicator symbols or positioning
- Underline the focused header
- Color the divider line based on which side is focused
- Subtle highlight on selected list items only in focused pane
- Different approach entirely?

## User Feedback Requested
What visual style would you prefer? Please add notes with examples or preferences.

title: Implement hive msg CLI command
description:
Create the msg command with pub/sub/list subcommands:

hive msg pub --topic <topic> [message | -f file | stdin]
  - Publish message to topic
  - Auto-detect sender from session ID
  
hive msg sub [--topic <pattern>] [--timeout duration] [--last N]
  - No topic: subscribe to all topics
  - With topic: filter by pattern (supports wildcards like agent.*)
  - --last N returns last N messages immediately
  - Without --last, polls for new messages until timeout
  
hive msg list [--json]
  - List all topics with message counts

Follow pattern from cmd_ctx.go for structure.
Location: internal/commands/cmd_msg.go
close_reason: Implemented hive msg CLI with pub/sub/list subcommands, auto sender detection, wildcard topic patterns, and polling for new messages

title: Add session ID detection from CWD
description:
Create utility to detect current hive session from working directory:

- Read sessions.json from $XDG_DATA_HOME/hive/sessions.json
- Find session where path matches or is prefix of CWD
- Return session ID for use as sender identifier in messages
- Return empty string if not in a hive session (allow anonymous publishing)

This enables automatic sender identification without manual configuration.
close_reason: Added SessionDetector to find current hive session from working directory with path prefix matching
